identified-content.person: MAIER, DR. SARAH ELIZABETH (DR. SARAH ELIZABETH FRIEDEWALD)

block.p: Dr. Sarah Elizabeth Maier, the daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Ward R. Maier of Belmont, Mass., was married yesterday to Dr. John Judd Friedewald, a son of Dr. and Mrs. William T. Friedewald of New York. The Rev. Daniel C. Kanter performed the ceremony at King's Chapel, a Unitarian church in Boston, with the Rev. Dr. Walter J. Smith, a Roman Catholic priest, taking part.

The bride and the bridegroom, both 28, are residents at Johns Hopkins Hospital in Baltimore, she in radiology and he in internal medicine. They received their medical degrees from Columbia University.

Dr. Sarah Elizabeth Maier, the daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Ward R. Maier of Belmont, Mass., was married yesterday to Dr. John Judd Friedewald, a son of Dr. and Mrs. William T. Friedewald of New York. The Rev. Daniel C. Kanter performed the ceremony at King's Chapel, a Unitarian church in Boston, with the Rev. Dr. Walter J. Smith, a Roman Catholic priest, taking part.

The bride and the bridegroom, both 28, are residents at Johns Hopkins Hospital in Baltimore, she in radiology and he in internal medicine. They received their medical degrees from Columbia University.

The bride, who is known as Sally, graduated from the University of Southern California. Her father is the assistant chairman of the anesthesiology department at Mount Auburn Hospital in Cambridge, Mass., and a clinical instructor at the Harvard Medical School. Her mother, Christine W. Maier, is a designer at the Weston (Mass.) Studio of Interior Design.

The bridegroom graduated from Princeton University, where he was a member of the 1992 men's lacrosse championship team in Division I of the N.C.A.A. His mother, Jacqueline J. Friedewald, is a commercial real estate agent in New York. His father is a clinical professor of medicine and public health at Columbia.
